result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikolaus A Raap was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to comply with DNA sample provision

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nikolaus A Raap

defendant.name: Raap, Nikolaus A
defendant.address: W375 S2371 Gramling Cir, Dousman, WI 53118

records.addlTxt: Letter from JESO re Defendants Huber

[MK] case called at 11:00am 
Defendant Nikolaus A Raap in court with Attorney Mark P. Powers. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.  After ADA Witt submits a printed victim impact statement and requests that the document be sealed due to the inclusion of the victim's name, the Court directs that instead the State is to efile the redacted version of the victim impact statement. [clerk's inserted note: post-hearing the printed victim impact statement is returned to ADA Witt]. 
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3.

On Count # 1 the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Raap on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--to serve 5 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith. Mr. Raap is required to report for commencement and service of jail term with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--to complete certified Batterers Intervention programming
--no violent contact with Victim 1
--no acts or threats of violence 
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and DNA surcharge

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
The Court finds that special disposition is appropriate. The Court grants the Defense request for Statute 973.015 expungement upon the successful completion of the Probation term. 
recess 11:19am
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
